direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods interact with the state of the iterator and handle exceptions related to the iterator's state.
Both methods check the state of the iterator and determine if operations are allowed based on the iterator's current state.
Both methods modify the internal state of the iterator, although reset() is more about resetting the iterator to its initial state.
Both methods involve removing an element, but the external method removes a specified object rather than the current iterator element.
